availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal. The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: Quæstiones in s. theologia [jure civili, philosophia, medicina] discutiendæ Oxonii in vesperiis decimo [duodecimo] die mensis Julii anno Dom. 1669
titleStmt.author: University of Oxford.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

revisionDesc.change: 2007-10 Apex CoVantageKeyed and coded from ProQuest page images
2007-11 Pip WillcoxText and markup reviewed and edited

div.head: QUAESTIONES IN S. THEOLOGIA DISCUTIENDAE OXONII IN VESPERIIS,

opener.date: Decimo Die Menſis Julii, Anno Dom. 1669.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris JOHAN. BRICE, è Coll. Novo.
div.p: An COnfirmatio ſit Sacramertum? Neg.
An Sint duo tantum in N. Teſtamento Sacramenta? Aff.
An Liceat contra Principem ſub quovis praetextu Religionis arma movere? Neg.

div.head: Quaestiones Incept. HENR. COMPTON, ex Aede Chriſti.
div.p: An Chriſtus, licèt non fuiſſet Deus, Cultu divino eſſet adorandus? Neg.
An Haeretici, qua haeretici, ſint morte puniendi? Neg.
An Patres ſub antiquo foedere promiſſiones tantum temporales habuerint? Neg.

div.head: Quaestiones Incept. GUIL. BETHEL, ex Aula S. Albani.
div.p: An Dominium temporale fundetur in gratiâ? Neg.
An In Miniſtris Evangelicis coelibatus neceſſariò requiratur? Neg.
An Bona opera renatorum ſint meritoria? Neg.

div.head: Quaestiones Incept. FRAN. TURNER, è Coll. Novo.
div.p: An Pontificii & Sectarii communionem Eccleſiae Anglicanae Recuſantes ſint Schiſmatici? Aff.
An Chriſtus verè ſatisfecit pro peccatis mundi? Aff.
An Preces pro defunctis antiquitùs uſurpatae aſtruant Romanenſium Purgatorium? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Incept. THO. MARSHAL, è Coll. Lincoln.
div.p: An Omnia ad ſalutem neceſſaria perfectè contineantur in S. Scripturà? Aff.
An S. Scripturae ſcrutatio omnibus Chriſtianis incumbat? Aff.
An Ad Scripturas ritè explicandas neceſſaria ſit inſpectio Fontium? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Incept. JOHAN. HALL, Coll. Pemb. Magiſtri.
div.p: An S. Scriptura ſit adaequata Fidei divinae regula? Aff.
An Sententia Concilii OEcumenici ſit ultima controverſiarum fidei deciſio? Aff.
An Judicium diſcretionis ſit cuivis Fidelium permittendum? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Incept. JOHAN. DARBYE, è Coll. Univerſ.
div.p: An Peccatum Originale ab Adamo in omnes poſteros traducatur? Aff.
An Paedobaptiſmus ſit licitus & probandus? Aff.
An Fides juſtificet ſub ratione conditionis? Aff.

div.head: Quaestiones Incept. THOMAE SPRAT è Coll. Wadham.
div.p: An Lex Moſaïca obliget Chriſtianos? Neg.
An Traditio Pontificia ſit certa fidei norma? Neg.
An Renunciandum ſit verae Religioni jubente Magiſtratu? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Incept. JOHAN. BARNARD è Coll. Lincoln.
div.p: An Eccleſia habeat poteſtatē deponendi principes haereticos? Neg.
An Sancti defuncti ſint invocandi? Neg.
An Calix in Euchariſtiâ ſit Laicis denegandus? Neg.

div.head: QUAESTIONES IN JURE CIVILI DISCƲTIENDAE IN ƲESPERIIS.
Quaeſtiones Incept. RICHARDI OSGOOD, è Coll. Novo.
div.p: An Delinquentium Nobilitas ad poenam minuendam valeat? Aff.
An Teneatur poenâ aliquâ qui noluit ſe interponere pro ſalute alterius? Aff.
An Pro re conductâ ſuperveniente peſte praeſtanda ſit Penſio? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Incept. GABR. THISTLETHWAIT, è Coll. Novo.
div.p: An Natus ante Regnum à Patre acquiſitum praeferatur ei qui poſtea natus eſt? Aff.
An Mandans delictū, & delinquens, pari poenâ ſint plectendi? Aff.
An Ex delicto defuncti Haeres teneatur? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Incept. CAROLI PERROT, è Coll. D. Joh. Bapt.
div.p: An Repreſſaliae ſint licitae? Aff.
An In causâ criminali Procurator intervenire poſſit? Neg.
An Scholaris cedens bonis Libros retineat? Aff.

div.head: QUAESTIONES IN MEDICINA DISCƲTIENDAE IN ƲESPERIIS.
Quaeſtiones Incept. THO. JAMESON, è Coll. Wadh.
div.p: An Aëris particulae ſanguini commiſceantur in reſpiratione? Neg.
An Detur accenſio ſanguinis in Corde? Aff.
An Propter inventa nuper Anatomica mutanda ſit medendi methodus? Neg.

div.head: Quaestiones Incept. EDVARDI JONES, è Coll. Mert.
div.p: An Calculus generetur ex feculentiis Tartareis? Aff.
An In morbis Peſtilentibus ac Malignis liceat Sanguinen▪ mittere? Aff.
An Sanguis nutriat? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Incept. NICOLAI HELE, è Coll. Exon.
div.p: An Chylificatio fiat a Calore? Aff.
An • cterus niger a liene proficiſcatur? Neg.
An Lien ſit ſedes Scorbuti? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Incept. THOMAE HAYES, è Coll. Aen. Naſi.
div.p: An Calor ſit de eſtentia Febris? Aff.
An Indicationes in morbis curandis ſequi debeat Medicus? Aff.
An Contraria contrariis rectiſſimè cu • entur? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Incept. PETRI GERARD, è Coll. Aen. Naſi.
div.p: An Concoctio fiat tantum a Calore? Neg.
An Philtra amorem inducere poſſint? Neg.
An Spiritus Vitalis producat ſanguinem? Aff.

div.head: QUAESTIONES IN PHILOSOPHIA DISCUTIENDAE IN VESPERIIS.
div.p: An Scientia ſit reminiſcentia? Neg.
An Omnis ſenſus ſit tactus? Aff.
An Planetae ſint habitabiles? Neg.
Reſp. GUIL. WATTS, incept. è Coll. Aen. Naſi.

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN SACRA THEOLOGIA DISCUTIENDAE OXONII IN COMITIIS,

opener.date: Duodecimo die Menſis Julii, Anno Dom. 1669.

div.p: An Poteſtas Civilis ſit immediatè a Deo? Aff.
An Miſſio requiratur in Miniſtris Evangelii? Aff.
An Fides juſtificans viribus naturalibus acquiri poſſit? Neg.
div.byline: Reſp. HENR. COMPTON, Incept. ex Aede Chriſti.

div.head: QUAESTIONES IN JURE CIVILI DISCUTIENDAE IN COMITIIS.
div.p: An Princeps ſit 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 ? Aff.
An Toleratio Sectarum in re Religionis ſit Juri Civili Rom. contraria? Aff.
An Mare ſit Liberum? Neg.
div.byline: Reſp. JOSEPHO TAYLOR Incept. è Coll. D. Joh. Bapt.

div.head: QUAESTIONES IN MEDICINA DISCUTIENDAE IN COMITIIS.
div.p: An Lien miniſtret fermentum Ventriculo? Neg.
An Bilis ſit excrementum? Aff.
An Dari poſſit ratio ligaturae in Phlebotomià, ante inventam Circulationem Sanguinis? Neg.
div.byline: Reſp. PETRO GERARD Incept. è Coll. Aen. Naſi.

div.head: QUAESTIONES IN PHILOSOPHIA DISCUTIENDAE IN COMITIIS.
div.p: An Seneſcente mundo adoleſcat ingenium? Aff.
An Mores animi ſequantur temperamentum corporis? Aff.
An Aſtrologus praedicere poſſit futura contingentia? Neg.
div.byline: Reſp. GUIL. HOPKINS A. M. ex Aula B. Mariae.

div.p: OXONIAE, Typis LICHFIELDIANIS Acad. Typogr. Anno Dom. 1669.
